Additional Notes: Personal stories and examples are used throughout the episode to illustrate points. Emphasis on the practical application of courtesy in everyday life and business. [...] # The Pierce Marrs Show

The Pierce Marrs Show is your place for business, sales, and, developing connective communication with your team and clients. If you are a leader or entrepreneur and want to grow your business and be more profitable, with fewer headaches, then you are at the right place.

## Episodes

### Common Courtesy: Your Secret Weapon for Success and Strong Relationships [...] 11/17/2022

### Kevin Harrington Interview

Listen in as Pierce interviews one of the original Sharks and the founder of the infomercial, Kevin Harrington. Kevin has a remarkable story of entrepreneurship and has been responsible for 6 billion in sales worldwide.  To Contact Pierce, click this link: PierceMarrs.com

The Definition of Success

11/17/2022

### The Definition of Success

In this episode, Pierce shares what he has learned about the definition of success and how you can put yourself in the top three percent of people who are moving forward and achieving their goals in 2023. For more details on Goal Setting, click this link: PierceMarrs.com To hear The Strangest Secret by Earl Nightingale, click this link: The Strangest Secret

data.title: Liberate Your Soul - With Kelly Pierce - Apple Podcasts
data.snippet:
# Liberate Your Soul - With Kelly Pierce

A podcast designed to quiet the inner imposter, awaken you to truths known within all of us so that you can discover your purpose, heal heart wounds, and find where you fit in to feel whole and allow you to make positive lasting impact on the world.
I help top performers find their authentic selves in order to come from a confident decision-making place. As a fellow seeker I have found that liberating the soul enables anyone to transition from anxiety to acceptance. It is my hope to help you find the truest expression of your soul, while taming the ego without having to dampen your spirit.

## Episodes

12/05/2024

### 174. Planting Seeds for 2025 (You're Invited!) [...] ### Must Listen

08/03/2021

Jorge4President

Kelly is very intuitive, passionate and has a genuine desire to make people a better version of themselves. This podcast is a must consume for everyone from people struggling in life to those who have the world at their feet. Thanks Kelly for being yourself!

### Amazing!

Everyone needs to listen to Kelly. Her podcasts are incredible.

### Insightful

I have enjoyed listening to these pod casts by Kelly Pierce. They are thoughtful, encouraging and insightful. I appreciate the positive perspectives in such uncertain times.

## The United States and Canada [...] The Inner Voice is a well of wisdom from deep within that we all have and can tune into in different ways. Like when you just know not to go a certain route to work or avoid a situation because you “had a feeling”. At the end of this episode I share a snippet of a session that I recently had that helped me come to a decision that will set up the next direction in life I want to take. It was life changing! We all have choices to make each day on how we are going to perceive our experiences, the habits we have, the thoughts we think, and the feelings we feel, but it is up to US to make those choices. Life can either be a tragedy or a comedy, but it is in the small moments that awareness can come, and knowing we get the opportunity to choose again and again is so liberating. Whether it’s

data.title: Who invented the word 'podcast'? - The Verge
data.snippet:
# They're called "podcasts"

By David PierceDesign by Cath VirginiaBuilt by Graham MacAree

Before a podcast was a “podcast,” it was… well, it wasn’t really much of anything. A few of the early believers called them “audio blogs,” and the journalist often credited with coining the term “podcast” also offered “GuerillaMedia” as an alternative in the very same article. (And actually, there’s plenty of debate over exactly who coined the term and when. The history of the podcast is more contentious than you’d think.) [...] It was in 2004, though, that many of the earliest names in on-demand audio began to smush “iPod” and “broadcast” into the word we’ve come to know as the way we all download and listen to shows now. In the 20 years since podcasts became a thing, they’ve changed dramatically — the earliest pods were mostly just dudes blogging into microphones, but now the medium supports everything from award-winning investigations to narrative fiction on par with anything you’d find on TV. And to be fair, a lot of dudes blogging into microphones. [...] On this episode of The Vergecast, we go back two decades to the first days of the podcast. We talk to some of the people who created the earliest shows, decided how the format would work, and developed both the technology and the norms that still define the industry today. Like so many stories during the early days of the internet, it involves a small number of people (and a Yahoo mailing list) who had no idea how big their little project would get.
